page.title: 01Part of The West Midlands
page.content: This block situated approximately five miles from the centre of Birmingham is mainly residential, half being in Birmingham - half Solihull. As such it is well served by shops and schools. There are three main shopping areas - at Â£The Swan' and Â£The Wheatsheaf' on the A.45 (Birmingham to Coventry road) which cuts across the northern edge of the area, and at Â£The Green' in Acocks Green.There are 17 Primary and 3 Secondary schools in the block. Several parks and playing fields and the tree-lined streets help to make a pleasant place to live. As well as excellent bus services the area is served by two stations at Acocks Green and Olton on the Birmingham-Paddington railway.The largest firm is The Rover car company with a factory and a test track. Several smaller firms dot the western edge of the area.
